intro: Hesperoscordum, commonly known as the California fennel, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Hesperoscordum is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its seeds are small and can be dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to thrive in varied environments.
